instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3023-A No Power not charge
threads.message:
Hello
PP_3v42_G3H ok
PPBUS_G3H ok
I have examined the power supply circuit of the 5v and the 3v3
starting from C9487 up to U7101 and pin 25.
in both I find the voltage unstable, can the defect be Q7260?

threads.title: 820-3023-A No Power not charge
threads.message:
What are you checking on thunderbolt power rail (C9487), if board doesn't even turn on?
No relation at all with Q7260 (3V3_S5).

Do you get correct SMC_RESET_L and SMC_ADAPTER_EN?
What is the exact PPBUS_G3H voltage (no battery connected)?

threads.title: 820-3023-A No Power not charge
threads.message:
SMC_RESET_L = 3,34 V
SMC_ADAPTER_EN= the voltage is unstable
PPBUS_G3H= 8.40 V no battery connected

threads.title: 820-3023-A No Power not charge
threads.message: SMC_PM_G2_EN comes on, stable?

threads.title: 820-3023-A No Power not charge
threads.message: SMC_PM_G2_EN unstable equal

threads.title: 820-3023-A No Power not charge
threads.message: 3V3_S5 fluctuating in the same manner as SMC_PM_G2_EN?

threads.title: 820-3023-A No Power not charge
threads.message: exact

threads.title: 820-3023-A No Power not charge
threads.message:
Power cycles every 3-5s, or how?
Do you note pulse on other big coils?

threads.title: 820-3023-A No Power not charge
threads.message: up and down fast also on L7260

threads.title: 820-3023-A No Power not charge
threads.message:
You've already said that before; L7260 mis for 3V3_S5.
I expected some indication about L7220.

Check for short on all big coils.

threads.title: 820-3023-A No Power not charge
threads.message: L7220 and 0 I measured U7201 and accidentally short circuited two pins now ppbus_g3h and 2.34v Maybe I created problems with U7000, pp3v3 no longer pulsates, I'm still a beginner

threads.title: 820-3023-A No Power not charge
threads.message:
Always choose surrounding components as test points.
Avoid such problems touching directly chip pins.

Post diode mode to ground at PPBUS_G3H and L7220/60; red probe on ground.

threads.title: 820-3023-A No Power not charge
threads.message: L7220 has low insulation 0.002

threads.title: 820-3023-A No Power not charge
threads.message:
That means short to ground on 5V_S3.
Do you have the same value at PPBUS_G3H?
If yes, Q7220 is also shorted (D-S).

threads.title: 820-3023-A No Power not charge
threads.message: I found a hole on Q7260 and replace it on L8220 I don't have low insulation. I removed F7040 to see the short on ppbus_g3h, but now I get 3.24v is it not that I have to replace u7000? One last question, I found Q7260 on a SIZ710DT donor card only that instead of 17W, there is 15W I have to check the data sheet or well the same?

threads.title: 820-3023-A No Power not charge
threads.message:
No problem, if pads layout is the same for both.

Did you check if Q7220 is shorted D-S?
Changing Q7260 doesn't eliminate the short to ground from L7220.

threads.title: 820-3023-A No Power not charge
threads.message: So, I replaced Q7260 and pp3v3 returned PPBUS_g3H also returned to normal value, on L7220 I found C7252 with low insulation. But is U1800 normal for it to be very hot? Or did I create problems with it? Now I only have 5V S3 to restore

threads.title: 820-3023-A No Power not charge
threads.message:
U1800 is the PCH and shouldn't get very hot in off state.
Very likely the PCH is dead now; because of 3V3_S5 overvoltage.

threads.title: 820-3023-A No Power not charge
threads.message: But by whom is the overvoltage caused? Can't I do anything?

threads.title: 820-3023-A No Power not charge
threads.message:
Guess what happened when Q7260 got burnt.
If PCH gets very hot now, when only 3V power rails are available on the board, then is dead.

As board is in off state, only RTC and system power management blocks of PCH are powered up.
No reason at all to get even warm.

threads.title: 820-3023-A No Power not charge
threads.message: But without the PCH I will never get the 5V S3? Can I interrupt the 3v3s that go to the PCH get the 5V somehow and then replace the PCH? Otherwise I give up

threads.title: 820-3023-A No Power not charge
threads.message:
5V_S3 is controlled by PCH, via PM_SLP_S4_L; as any other S3 voltage.
You can force 5V_S3 power supply, but what do you expect?
PCH is dead...

threads.title: 820-3023-A No Power not charge
threads.message: So the next move could be to change the PCH?

threads.title: 820-3023-A No Power not charge
threads.message:
If you still have short on 5V_S3 power rail, should be better to find it first.
Also check for short on other power rails.

threads.title: 820-3023-A No Power not charge
threads.message: I eliminated the short by replacing C7252 I checked after L7220 and the low insulation disappeared but still nothing PP5V_S3 probably because of the PCH if I understood correctly

threads.title: 820-3023-A No Power not charge
threads.message: Yes, PCH doesn't enable S3 power state.

threads.title: 820-3023-A No Power not charge
threads.message: Just out of curiosity, what do you mean by forcing 5V_S3?

threads.title: 820-3023-A No Power not charge
threads.message:
Forcing its enable signal, instead of using PM_SLP_S4_L from PCH.
Remove R7913 and check L7220 voltage.
If no volt, run a wire from R7251 to R7252 abd test again.

threads.title: 820-3023-A No Power not charge
threads.message: Removing R7913 The PCH is no longer hot, it also disappeared 3v3_S5 then I joined R7151 and R7252 but on L7220 always 0V

threads.title: 820-3023-A No Power not charge
threads.message:
3V3_S5 power rail is enabled through R7941.
Removing R7913 forces 5V_S3 and probably U7201 detects a fault on this rail and disables both outputs.

All this doesn't have much sense if you don't want to change PCH...

threads.title: 820-3023-A No Power not charge
threads.message: I found one that equals 820-3023 A but has a low insulation on L7330, as you advise me to proceed
